channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump says U.K. return of Chagos Islands to Mauritius is reason to acquire Greenland
item.description: The president previously supported Britain's agreement to hand back sovereignty of the Indian Ocean archipelago, where the U.K. continues to lease the...

item.title: 'The miracle': A 6-year-old walked away from the train wreck that killed her family
item.description: Her parents, brother and cousin were killed in the collision, but the girl was found walking barefoot on the tracks. She's being cared for by grandpar...

item.title: ASEAN won't endorse election in military-ruled Myanmar, Malaysia says
item.description: Malaysia's foreign minister Mohamad Hasan cited concerns over the lack of inclusive and free participation.

item.title: The divorce between the U.S. and WHO is final this week. Or is it?
item.description: The U.S. is the only country allowed to withdraw from the World Health Organization. And Jan. 22 is the day when Trump's pullout announcement should g...

item.title: Here's who's canceled their Kennedy Center performances since Trump took over
item.description: The Martha Graham Dance Company is just the latest to say they will no longer perform at the Kennedy Center since Trump took over last year.

item.title: China "super embassy" greenlit in London despite concerns
item.description: Despite fears of Chinese spying and hacking, the British government gave the go-ahead for China to build a massive new embassy in the heart of London.

item.title: Shock and confusion as Spain struggles for answers after deadly train crash
item.description: Investigators remain baffled by the cause of Sunday's deadly crash in the south of the country.

item.title: Europe to suspend approval of US tariffs deal
item.description: The move follows renewed tensions between the US and EU, as Donald Trump pushes to acquire Greenland.

item.title: Second lady Usha Vance announces she is pregnant with fourth child
item.description: Vice President JD Vance and second lady Usha Vance announced they are expecting their fourth child.

item.title: Trump talks Greenland, Nobel Prize, more in press briefing marking one year of second term
item.description: President Trump spoke about a number of topics Tuesday in a White House press briefing that marked his first year back in office. CBS News chief White...

item.title: Lyse Doucet: Trump is shaking the world order more than any president since WW2
item.description: Trump's demands over Greenland are a rude awakening in a moment fraught with risk.

item.title: Ukraine's parliament and half of Kyiv with no heating after Russian strikes
item.description: President Zelensky says Russia has started using "far more" ballistic missiles in its attacks on Ukraine.

item.title: Justice Department subpoenas Walz and others in immigration enforcement obstruction investigation

item.title: Forecasters warn of a ‘potentially catastrophic’ storm from Texas to the Carolinas
UK defends Chagos deal after Trump calls it 'act of great stupidity'
item.description: The US president says it is "another in a very long line of National Security reasons why Greenland has to be acquired".

item.title: DOJ subpoenas Walz, Frey, others in probe alleging immigration obstruction

item.title: Judge bars Lindsey Halligan's continued use of U.S. attorney title

item.title: Christian leaders urge protecting worshippers’ rights after protesters interrupt service
